ygData.subject: Re: Level progression
ygData.msgSnippet: I am Heidrich, a 7th level Paladin. I reside in the city of Qeynos. Of late, I have spent the majority of my time slaying lions and grizzly bears in the
ygData.messageBody:
I am Heidrich, a 7th level Paladin. I reside in the city of Qeynos.
Of late, I have spent the majority of my time slaying lions and
grizzly bears in the Karanas with my fellow adventurer Rastaman, who
is an 8th level warrior. My point is, we started adventuring
together when we both hit level 5. We found that I got 65-70% as
much xp as he did for killing enemies in a group. Now I do not know
what the exact figure is, but that is what we found. That is why he
has progressed to level 8 and I still remain at 7. However, the
hybrid class benefits, in my opinion, far outweigh any extra xp-
gaining time.


>From: "Steve Price" <silten@...>
>Reply-To: Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com
>To: "Bristlebane EQ Onelist" <Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com>
>Subject: [Bristlebane_EQ] Level progression
>Date: Wed, 14 Apr 1999 10:23:30 +0100
>
>From: "Steve Price" <silten@...>
>
>I've not been able to get online for a week or so (except email),
due to
>moving house, and I feel a bit out of touch.
>
>My character is still a lowly 3rd level Erudite Wizard, due to
limited
>playing time, but it has taken a lot more work than my beta
character did
>(Barby Shamen).
>
>How are you all finding progression? I'm in no great hurry, and I'm
>certainly not a power player, but I get the feeling that some
class/race
>combos have a much easier time of it than others, perhaps too much
for
>balance.
>
>I know the hybrid classes have to earn more experience, but does
anyone know
>any details?
>
>Steve
>
>
